description.narrative: Procuring and providing shelter packages and addressing sanitation needs.

The RI program aims at saving lives of the earthquake affected communities by risk reduction activities related primarily to shelter and sanitation. RI will provide shelter packages to remote communities with limited or no access to markets and will provide Cash For Work (CFW) support to communities, with relatively easier access to markets, so that they can meet their urgent cash needs. The CFW activities will involve the clearing away of debris from public spaces so that risk of injury, especially for children, disabled and elderly, is minimized and mobility is improved. Shelter packages comprise shelter material, tool kit, some building material and emergency latrines and are thus composed to build on existing construction skills and utilise construction materials people are accustomed to handling. The most vulnerable, especially women, elderly and disabled, will be given priority for receiving assistance. It is envisaged that RI will simultaneously provide different villages with shelter packages to save time and equip people, ahead of time, for the impending monsoon onset. The RI and partner technical team will provide basic assistance to beneficiaries on building shelters with materials provided. Furthermore, it is expected that such packages may contribute to reducing post disaster trauma and encouraging affected populations to resolve their shelter needs by themselves. The shelter tool kit is expected to further facilitate affected people in retrieving materials and making their own additions to existing shelters.
